data.text:
Peter Romagna

Senior Program Manager

Peter is an arts leader and educator with a passion for arts education and youth enrichment. He holds a Bachelors of Fine Arts in Musical Theatre from The Boston Conservatory at Berklee as well as a Masters Degree in Arts Administration from Boston University. As a professional actor for nearly 20 years, he has had the opportunity to travel the world in countless productions including touring productions of Miss Saigon choreographed by Broadway veteran Baayork Lee, the New England Premiere of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert at the Shubert Theater in Boston, and regional theaters across the country. Peter has also been featured in numerous cabaret acts in and around NYC including some of the top venues such as Feinstein's/54 Below, Birdland Jazz Club, The Duplex, and The Oak Room at the Plaza Hotel.

Through performance and world travel Peter has had the opportunity to work with and learn from other arts leaders, professionals, actors, and youth from a variety of different backgrounds, experiences and lifestyles to better understand the arts education sector and continue the discussion and action plan around inclusion to remove access barriers to arts education for youth of all ages. Peter is also a teaching artist and has had the opportunity to work with youth artists throughout his career through masterclasses, children's theater affiliations, workshops and directing which always remains a joy and privilege in his life.

Peter joined the team at RAW in 2023.
